Reviews.Title: “Decent room, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: ratodino
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting the sights of Branson. Location was close to the landings so easy to get to the downtown area only 3 blocks away. Room was clean and they had tried to give it some charm with a dresser for a vanity and antique bronze fixtures, but it was very small. Even for just 2 people, it felt very cramped. Front desk clerks were extremely helpful and friendly. Small indoor pool that no one was ever in. It was supposed to be heated, but still kind of chilly for this time of year. Their advertised new hot tub was just a residential type that was sitting outside the back door of the lobby under a gazebo. It was only working one night out of the 3 that we were there and it looked overcrowded with one other couple already in it. Full breakfast was included in the room price and was pretty good. Overall, this hotel served our needs and I would stay again if I was in the area. Nothing fancy, but clean and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and location”
Reviews.Author: Hal H
Reviews.Content: We had family in to visit and took them to Branson and wanted something close to the Landing. We were so pleased with the Best Western. Our rooms were updated and very nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. We took the family to see the Presley's and the show was great. A perfect weekend. I highly recommend the Best Western Landing and the Presley's Country Jubilee!

Reviews.Title: “gross motel - trashy at best”
Reviews.Author: underwaterman
Reviews.Content: My company stuck me hear and I couldn't be more upset. This place is a dump. Smells like mildew and the rooms are the size of my bathroom at home. It's an travesty. No idea how people give this place 4 or 5 stars - they must have very low standards. Possibly one of the worst places to stay in branson which says a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: deebeeinar
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay was good. When stayed in a king size jacuzzi suite. The bed was clean & comfortable and the bed linens appeared to be in fairly new condition. The jacuzzi was clean and very relaxing at the end of a few days in the heat. The furniture, towel racks, shower curtain rod, etc. have been updated as well. We slept comfortably during our stay. The free breakfast provided consisted of waffles, fruit, cereal, eggs, sausage, yogurt, and juice. The only thing I wished to see that was missing was a soda fountain machine, I'm not a coffee or juice drinker in the morning, but need my caffiene in a different form. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Rudy P
Reviews.Content: I had booked a suite a corner suite 2 rooms when I got there and checked it was not the write room so I went back down and showed them my on line order. well they said the problem was it wasn't avliable for 3 nights just 2. But the girl at the desk said let me talk to the manager. Next thing I know they gave me a up grade to a pent house with a hot tub and a patio with a bar on it. It was so nice of them and the room made my stay so awesome. I was there for a family wedding. The whole staff was so great and the room was spotless. I wish I could remember there names to thank them on here I do remember Jonathan him and a girl sorry cant remember your name cleaned my room. I had a hornets nest on the patio and she called down on the spot to have it removed Jonathan was trying but in like 2 minutes a guy came up and it was done. Thats what I call customer service. You love everthing about the hotel and the location is the best just 2 blocks to the landing. Thank you all so much it was a 5 star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at Landing View”
Reviews.Author: Susan O
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location to walk to the shops, restaurants, and water landing area of Branson, Mo. The staff was very pleasant and helpful during our three day stay. Our room appeared newly refurbished with quaint antique-looking furnishings. We were especially pleased with the free wifi and T.V. Breakfast was also good and the pool was clean. This was a great hotel for the price. We will stay in Best Westerns in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Clyde F
Reviews.Content: My military group held our 2012 reunion here and were very pleased, overall. The hotel's meeting rooms are pretty bare-bones, without projection or video equipment but the hotel staff pitched in to set us up with exclusive use of their rooftop patio for our meetings. The weather was good, so this was an ideal solution. I can't say enough about the efforts of the hotel employees in doing everything necessary to keep us comfortable and happy! The facilities and rooms are not new but are well-maintained and clean. An exception was the dripping bathroom faucet in my room. The breakfast lounge is clean and well appointed. Breakfast is basic: Fruit, cereal, etc. Hotel location is very convenient to the upscale Landing shopping/dining development.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Rooms a Little Tight”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRanger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during business trip based on reviews. I tend to shy away from Best Western brands because the quality of properties is so inconsistent. This was not a bad stay. Property and room were clean and appealing. Good downtown (old town) location. Very warm and friendly staff, some of the best I've experienced. Room was very nicely decorated and quiet. All outside entrances. However the room was tight to maneuver in. Careful in the bathroom, no room for error lest you fall into the bathub or hit your toe closing the door before sitting on the throne. The desk table and chairs were impracticle to use due to their close proximity to the bed, A/C heater and the entrance door. Parking is a little tight also being snuggled between other businesses. Make sure your parkng brake works because you will be parking on a hill. The breakfast is the usual fare, nothing to write home about. Defintely consider this hotel but keep in mind there are others to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Updated, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jonricha
Reviews.Content: Really good value. Less than $90 with clean rooms and friendly staff. The rooms were in good shape (furniture, appliances, carpet recent, not worn out like other hotels). Only downside was room size. We had a king room and it was pretty tight. Another in our group had a double queen room and it seemed a little larger. The staff was great. I called ahead with a long list of questions about the area, hotel, etc trying to plan things out and they were very friendly and helpful. I would be careful about requesting a room location. The hotel is built on a hill so the 3rd floor is more convenient than the first floor to the front desk/pool/breakfast area. I usually request a first floor room, but I am glad didn't this time.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Branson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arkansas_teacher90
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price. Had hoped for more of an exercise center (had three pieces of equipment) but didn't have time to utilize it much anyway. Parking lot is VERY steep; can only turn right when leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Rooms - Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: 50stateswithtwins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I researched and made hotel arangements for our recent family get together in Branson and we are so glad that we found this one! Our initial reaction was that the rooms seemed a little tight but they were clean and updated with fancy vanities. They each included a small fridge and microwave, plus we were delighted to see a DVD player that came in very handy with our little ones! The have an indoor pool that is all 3 feet (another plus with children) providing a fun, relaxing activitiy in the evening. We were very happy with the location - walking distance means you are seeing and doing things instead of sitting in traffic. When I laid my head on my pillow that night I do recall thinking how loud the traffic was on the street and I wondered if it would affect my sleep but before I knew it I was out. We all slept great, the beds were comfortable with nice linens. We loved having a substantial breakfast included, that give us the energy we needed for a long day playing at Silver Dollar City!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff/Great Location/Comfortable Clean Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Mary P
Reviews.Content: We organized a rather large group to stay booking possibly 40+ rooms. The location of this property is a huge reason and benefit to stay as it is within walking distance to Branson Landing and it is easy to navigate quick routes driving from the parking lot to other area attractions. Our people LOVED this. The rooms were Fresh, Updated, Clean and Super Comfortable. The CROWNING JEWEL is the Amazing Staff. Every/Any issue or concern is immediately handled with friendly and accommodating professionalism. It is obvious that the entire Staff Team is solution driven with a passion to go the extra mile and leave customers with a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: Janet T
Reviews.Content: On our arrival, I asked the front desk manager about the hot tub. She informed me it was broken. She could tell I was disappointed, and she went ahead and checked us in. When she handed me the keys and told us where our room was, I realized she had given us a suite with a jacuzzi. It was very nice, and we were able to relax and enjoy the room. Thank you to that person who made our stay well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great wedding day/honeymoney thanks to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sara C
Reviews.Content: Had great helpful staff! They let us check in early and helped to make our wedding day and our honey moon weekend go very smoothly! Very appreciated for the helpful staff here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Amenities, Beautiful Bedrooms, Courteous Care”
Reviews.Author: The_Real_Birdcatcher
Reviews.Content: Positives: clean, well appointed rooms, thoughtful and friendly customer care, close to downtown Branson Negatives: middle-aged mattress, average breakfast Staff members at the Best Western Plus at Branson Landing "get it". They understand that to be in the hospitality business, its important to be "hospitable"! We checked ratings in several places before booking and the hotel was highly regarded by customers. Those ratings are no mistake. We had an excellent experience at this hotel. We arrived about 1 a.m. after a grueling three-hour drive over fog-covered two-lane mountain roads. Despite the late hour the clerk cheerfully greeted us and quickly completed the check-in process. At registration the clerk presented a "rewards" sack containing a couple of bottles of water, a bag of microwave popcorn...and a number of sample products and coupons. The samples probably cost the hotel nothing, but the fact they were thoughtful enough to collect and package them was very impressive. I've never received anything quite like it from this level of hotel during a million miles of business travel. Our room was extremely clean and very well-appointed. It was somewhat cramped but had enough room for two. Among the amenities one detail caught my attention...a box with three electrical outlets attached to the table. In most places we must search for a spare wall outlet or recharge devices on the vanity. This box was just one of many examples of attention to detail. Other amenities included standards like a large flat-screen TV, ample dresser, coffeemaker and micro-fridge...and some unexpected luxuries like a vanity cabinet, extra pillows, and a towel folded into a swan. An indoor salt-water pool is available for those who want to relax and drift a while. At three feet deep, it's not designed for serious swimming. But it could be a great place to unwind. The hotel sits on a relatively steep hill overlooking historic downtown Branson. An easy downhill two-block walk gets you to Dicks Five-and-Dime and other shops. (Of course, you've got to walk uphill to return to the hotel!) Branson Landing lies about a half-mile further. We had a great time exploring the area on foot. The proximity to shops could be a real advantage "in-season" when Branson roads are clogged with cars. Although we had a wonderful stay, there were a couple of things that weren't quite as good as other hotels recently visited. While our bed wasn't "uncomfortable", the mattress obviously had been around a while. Our room faced Highway 76 and was sometimes noisy due to traffic outside. (Easy solution: ask for a room on the other side of the property.) The biggest disappointment was breakfast: it lacked variety we've seen at other hotels in this price range. Despite these minor flaws, we'd return here because of the overwhelmingly positive overall experience. From the front desk to the housekeepers to the general manager, everyone was kind, courteous, and efficient. Coupled with the comfortable room, thoughtful amenities and central location, the Branson Landing Best Western Plus is the type of place we wish we could find everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was hoping for...but it works”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night for our anniversary. We wanted to be close to the Branson Landing so this hotel seemed only right to choose. While our stay wasn't bad, it wasn't what I was hoping for. Access to the rooms is from outside so that was one big draw back for me. Because of this, we heard so much noise that it really was bothersome--People walking, yelling (since it was outside), cars & trucks revving up/driving around, cleaning crew's cart was loud rolling over concrete, etc. We purposefully asked for a room away from the main street but that didn't really stop us from hearing sirens and other loud vehicles that drove past. We were also on the 2nd floor so we heard every step the people above us took. Our room was right on the corner of two walkways so we heard significant noise throughout the day and night since it was a high traffic area. The breakfast was typical-small biscuits and gravy, sausage, a few selections of cereal, small bagels and yogurt. Nothing over the top but it was free so that was a plus. Our room was very clean and nicely decorated. Our bed, however, had a large curve in it so as we slept, we slowly drifted towards each other. This was a little annoying as it cause me to sleep outside of my normal positions. The curtains kept the room dark so we were able to sleep much longer than we typically do. Overall, we may stay here again but it may not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “I like Best Western”
Reviews.Author: PaulaE659
Reviews.Content: Another winner with Best Western. A nice clean room, nice staff, good breakfast. Located right by old town and Bransons Landing.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: IslandLady76
Reviews.Content: This was at a great location. We spent 2 nights there for a company Christmas party so it was at a convenient location for shopping at the Landing, Tanger Mall. The staff was A+. The hot breakfast was hot and the attendant was very good. Everything was great except we were located next to main street so up until about 10:45 pm you could hear cars passing by, but after 11:00 I didn't notice any. So if you are an early sleeper you should ask for an inside room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Near The Landing in Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: donnaopfer
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this Best Western. Built in the 70's, it's been updated and has nice furnishings in the rooms and lobby. The staff was courteous and the location is great, if you don't want to stay on beautiful Tablerock Lake, but want to be within walking distance of Old Town Branson, The Landing shopping area, and Lake Taneycomo, and a short driving distance to the multitude of live theatre productions. I was also pleased to have a larger-than-average refrigerator, a flatscreen TV, microwave, and a bathroom area with a separate vanity. Even though the room was designated "smoking" (there were no non-smoking rooms available), the room smelled pleasant and I could not tell it had been a "smoking" room. The price was very good and I will stay here again. This is located in the beautiful Ozark Mountains, which is lush and green in the summer and exceptionally beautiful with the changing leaves in the Fall, not to mention the 4 million lights which illuminate a nearby amusement park with a country flair, Silver Dollar City for the holidays (beginning the first weekend of November).

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mt1990
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Best Western on Veterans Day weekend. We had such a wonderful time! The service was beyond friendly, and the rooms were kept nice and tidy. We will definitely be coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: 123-BL
Reviews.Content: We hadn't reserved rooms in Branson as we were not sure of our arrival date. This was the first place we checked upon arrival to Branson as it was directly on our route. The desk clerk was extremely friendly and helpful! We checked in and had very comfortable, clean accomodations. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT WE'LL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: sandra h
Reviews.Content: visit was great ,new to branson , wanted to see rooms had a great tour informed on pool,breakfast , front desk helped with shows and any other questions , she was great hope to return next year

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: CTZS
Reviews.Content: Check in went well. Nice place for the price and location. We would consider staying here again. Indoor Pool which was great as we had some rainy weather while being in Branson. Good breakfast for in the mornings. Great lacation to walk to downtown and the landing...if you don't mind all the hills! Parking lot is slanted too! I do believe we got our workout just going to and from the car! Rooms are cleaned daily. For the price rooms are smaller than what we are use to. The shower head did not have great water pressure but the sink had way too much water pressure. The vanity in the Suite we stayed in was too small for a woman with make-up and hair products. The mirror on the wall should have been above the desk area for vanity use. The closet had a shelf but not a sliding rod. We truely do not have any complaints we would stay here again. And much better here than where we stayed last year.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Here”
Reviews.Author: Rachelld66
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy, the staff could not have been friendlier and accomodating. The room was good, we had a queen suite which had a pull-out sofa. The room provided everything we needed. I really like the updated bathroom. The breakfast was good. They offer a great variety of hot and cold items. Staff members were constantly checking on the food making sure nothing got low. We especially appreciated the fridge with bottled water since both my daughter and I ran before breakfast and were very hot and thirsty. We did not use the pool. The fitness room did not look like it had much to offer. The location is awesome, just a short walk from the Landing with all the shops, restaurants and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HighHeat10917
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 3 nights at BW Branson Landing. Room was clean and cold. Very close to Old Town Branson and Branson Landing. Jeff checked on us daily at breakfast. No complaints would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Money”
Reviews.Author: dancersmom16
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, breakfast included, nice staff! Third Floor patio is a great gathering spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: OUChamps29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a brief weekend trip around spring break. We arrived late at night (after 11pm) after a decent drive, and the staff was very welcoming and friendly. We had book a standard king room, but those turned out to be all full, so they upgraded us to a suite! We enjoyed the extra space and the couch. The room was very clean, and looked fairly recently remodeled. You can still tell this is an older hotel, some of the remodeling looked like it didn't quite fit in (for example the crown molding around the top of the room that was separated from the wall in many places. Still, we enjoyed the room very much. The one downside to our stay was the huge number of kids in town for spring break. We went to go swimming one night and the small pool was chock full of kids. We went back to our rooms and watched TV instead. The location is great for walking down to the Branson Landing area... the area of town we like to spend our evenings in. Our days are spent typically at Silver Dollar City, which isn't quite as convenient to this hotel. That said, it is very nice that this hotel is on 76, but not in the "busy" part. We were able to quickly get out and take the alternative routes around Branson to avoid the traffic on the strip. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and the price was decent. There are cheaper hotels in town, but for the proximity to downtown and the landing, this place is tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelisnecessary
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels in Branson. I would not recommend this one. I booked a suite and, upon arrival, discovered that the A/C was not working. The desk clerk said to wait ten minutes and a line that was frozen would unfreeze. Shortly thereafter, he said the unit was broken and could not be fixed. I needed a suite because I was traveling with several children. Because I needed more space than a single room and because the suite was not useable, the clerk then offered two smaller rooms and recommend that some of the children stay by themselves alone in the second room. UNBELIEVABLE!! When asked for another hotel we were directed to The Hillbilly Inn (just what you might expect from a hotel with such a name). Stay away from this place is my advice!!

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: luvyablue
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is walking distance to quaint downtown, with it's antique shopping and eateries and the Branson Landing . Instead of the traffic and cheesiness of the strip, Best Western Landing View sits in a cute historic neighborhood. The room was clean and roomy. Loved having a mini-fridge and a microwave. The indoor pool is big and the morning breakfast was good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This is the only place I'd stay whenever we come back to Branson

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: davids68girl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel very much. It was clean and well maintained. The front desk staff was great-very friendly and helpful. The location was wonderful-within walking distance of Branson Landing. We enjoyed the indoor pool and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tgaspard
Reviews.Content: Loved the stay and especially the swan on the bed when we arrived. The room was completely gorgeous and smelled fresh and we had a pet room. Was only minutes away from everything. Rooms were quiet and never heard the pets next door because the rooms are that sound proof! Price is normal as far as all the other best westerns we have ever stayed in and that is all we stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kruzinkate
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Best Western very hot and ready to relax. The room was very nice with modern updates. The bed was fantastic, so very comfortable and the pillows were excellent. There was even an extra pillow in the room. We would totally stay there again on our next trip to Branson. We walked to the Landings, so close and so much to do. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, value, and location for our money!”
Reviews.Author: JSB58
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a great part of Branson, more toward Branson Landing and all the fabulous shopping. By staying more toward the downtown area, it was more quiet than being in the middle of Hwy.76 and all the hustle and hubbub. Although it was still very quick to drive 5 minutes right into all the activity on 76. Our room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay there again and recommend this Best Western to anyone. Also, we loved the free breakfast every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service, staff went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: suzanne1151
Reviews.Content: Working with the staff here made our stay so easy! From the front desk personnel to housekeeping everyone was very knowledgable, personable, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vetteset_93
Reviews.Content: This hotel was neat, clean and very customer friendly. The front desk staff member was very helpful, cheerful and was able to check us in efficiently and without any problems. The room was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very well done the next morning and got us up and on our way with smiles even though it was pouring rain and not one of Branson's better weather days. I'd recommend this hotel without question. It is located within easy walking distance of Branson Landing and the downtown district and all the staff we dealt with were courteous, friendly and very helpful. Thank you for a wonderful nights' stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Rates & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chabi670
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson for a long weekend. We were going to originally stay at the Hilton Landing but could not fathom paying $169 a night! We booked this room for 2 nights and paid the same as one night at the Hilton. This hotel is in the Branson Landing/Historic Downtown area of Branson. We easily walked from our hotel to the Landing (maybe took 10 minutes). There is a sidewalk the entire way and it is well lit at night. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast for guests. It had the typical fresh fruit, store bought pastries, coffee, juice, waffles. It also has biscuits and gravy! We were in a King, it was clean, nice linens on the bed, had a refrigerator, microwave, dvd player and coffeepot in the room. We were directly by the indoor pool and did not hear any noise. The only noise we heard were families walking up and down the walkways outside our door. Overall… good rates and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Quality”
Reviews.Author: bakimzey
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is good. Location is great for walking to the Branson Landing or downtown. For the price this is a nice motel to stay at. We visit Branson regulary and always stay here. The only drawback is staying in a room on the street side. On the weekend, the traffic noise can be loud. Besides the traffic noise, I would highly recommend the motel.

Reviews.Title: “had a wonderful stay at Best Western”
Reviews.Author: ksrudd1962
Reviews.Content: had a great time, priced right.. perfect. gift for rewards too cool. quiet. no reservation was needed. made Christmas shopping a breeze, within distance of all the best shopping. will stay again when in the area. service was very friendly and helpful. refrigerator, microwave. the best was the comfortable bed and awesome pillows. the least liked was the vanity sink by the bathroom was peeling and needed to be polished since it is brass or replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Christma get away!”
Reviews.Author: Momofgjj
Reviews.Content: We had a great night at Branson at the Best Western Plus Landing View Inn and Suites. We had a free night and enjoyed the hotel. The kids enjoyed the pool and the wifi in the room worked great! They also had a blast with that! The hide a bed was not the most comfortable one in the world, but the kids did ok on it! Overall we had a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, far from Branson attractions”
Reviews.Author: katiebnic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is to the east of 65 coming in from the north, away from Branson's attractions that had brought us to the area. This got us going in the wrong direction just as we entered Branson, which with all the traffic, lost us some time. You can forget about walking anywhere from the hotel, there's not much of interest in this area. The hotel room was clean except for some dirt on the walls that we noticed. We also had a pillow that either was stained or dirty. The lighting was nice, the decor was scuffy but very tasteful. We could hear our fellow occupants outside fairly well from inside our room. But the heat was great and the bed was comfortable so we still really enjoyed our stay. The staff too was friendly and breakfast in the morning was most welcome. Would and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Manager”
Reviews.Author: Marines4Life
Reviews.Content: For starters, the check-in went ok, but we were directed to the wrong room by the manager; strike 1. Before we opened our door the manager popped up smoking away on a cigarette. She came up to our door smoking, we are non-smokers, and her smoke was going into our room; strike 2. We put our bags into the room and went out. When we came back to the hotel we decided on the hot tub, which was broken; strike 3. So we settled on the pool, which is only 3ft deep; strike 4. My wife decided that maybe we should just shower and go on to bed. There was tooth paste all over the mirror and what we believe to be urine on our toilet; strike 5. We called the front desk, who told us that we could come and get cleaning supplies if we wanted, we did; strike 6. The beds were not too bad and the sheets were clean. In the morning after breakfast, we approached the manager and voiced our complaints. She quickly informed us that she had let her housekeeping manager go and she was inspecting the rooms; strike 7. She made no attempt to offer any adjustment or even an apology. She did however tell us that she was TRYING while smoking yet again. This is not a professionally ran hotel. Next time we will stay at the Mom/Pop down the road. Not worth the $100 price tag!! We checked out that day and bunked with family.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler92262
Reviews.Content: Room was squeaky clean as well as lobby and breakfast room. Breakfast had good variety. Staff was always courteous and helpful. Room was also very quiet, We never heard anything from either of the rooms next to us like you can in some hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service made our stay very enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: rabrannon
Reviews.Content: The clerk at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. She went out of her way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable, and offered suggestions on what my guests and I may want to check out during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: osulouTulsa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times & especially love the suites with the sofa, refrigerator & separate vanity. It's just off of the busy 76 & within walking distance of the Landing.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: fidlme1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times and love it everytime. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are clean, the location is perfect, the staff is efficient and friendly, the A/C worked great. Everything I look for in a hotel this place exceeds, and I'm picky.

Reviews.Title: “checked out early”
Reviews.Author: lizm_60
Reviews.Content: They updated the decor inside, but out of 3 rooms (all of which were a bit damp) 1 toilet had an issue, and 1 sink had an issue. They fixed things and were very pleasant about it all, but it just wasn't worth staying another night. It felt dank and tired, even with the updated decor. Maybe other sections of the motel were better. The location was decent but that wasn't enough for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but think twice before staying”
Reviews.Author: mabemom
Reviews.Content: The Best Western at Branson Landing is the perfect location for visiting the Branson Landing area. Convenient to Red/Blue routes, walking distance to historic shops and Branson Landing. We chose this hotel because of the location. We didn't want to pay for the Hilton and this was the only other hotel walking distance to the Landing. Our room was on the street side, facing the busy street. We heard traffic noise all night long. The room was clean but the bathroom and sink area were very small. Too small for a mom and 2 teenage girls to get ready in a reasonable lenth of time. The breakfast was good and there was an attendant taking care of it constantly. Waffle maker, breakfast sandwiches, cereal, yogart, bagels, muffins, biscuits and sausage gravy were all good. Beds were very comfortable but were doubles, not queens. I am recommending this hotel but with recommendation to request a room away from the main street. About the Landing...we LOVED it! Labor Day w/e had free concerts at night that were awesome. We loved walking around the shops and stopping to enjoy the music. The teenagers loved it and wanted to hang out there 2 nights in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised and impressed with the service.”
Reviews.Author: rridling
Reviews.Content: Was in Branson for a convention and unable to get a reservation at either Hilton location for the week. I wanted a place close to the convention center and found the BW Landing View to be a great location. A short 3 block walk through historic downtown Branson to the convention center meant not having to find parking during a busy convention! The room was extremely clean and well-maintained. Amenities included nice sized drawers in dresser and a good sized closet, fridge, microwave, etc. The bed comfortable and the linens were very nice. I personally appreciated the cleanliness of the room and bathroom and found housekeeping requests answered promptly (i.e. more coffee packets, extra soap, etc.) With wireless internet and a full breakfast included in the room rate, this was a great value for the price. My only disappointment was the "exercise room" which consisted of an older treadmill, a stationary bike and a really bad elliptical machine. The equipment needs some upgrading and the room a few more amenities - music, a TV, towels. Fortunately, I was walking to the convention center and got some exercise, but I would have enjoyed the opportunity to work out on my normal schedule. Overall a really good stay and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “KEEP LOOKING!!!”
Reviews.Author: evansmom95
Reviews.Content: We did not feel safe in this hotel. The staff was yelling at eachother and smoking their cigarettes on the grounds and totally disregarded our children. I strongly suggest that if you have a family, to keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately chose this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: angroehl
Reviews.Content: This was the first time either my new husband or I had been out of our home state of MN and this place was perfect. They were very flexible to our schedule. When we needed fax services from our bank back home they were very accommodating. Location was also excellent! We were on the strip yet not in the middle of the hustle and bustle. We were able to walk to the activities down on the landing and then walk back to our room with ease. Thank you to the staff there who were so helpful!

Reviews.Title: “the manager at this hotel provided us helpful information that we would never receive from the travel guides”
Reviews.Author: slsvend
Reviews.Content: Bruce, the manager, was very friendly and most helpful. His suggestions for meals and sites to see made our stay very interesting and relaxing. The rooms were nicely updated. Both the rooms and the grounds were clean and well cared for. The rooftop deck was relaxing and provided a great view of downtown Banson and The Landing.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced, Worn out, noisy, and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Sedalia_MONew_Hoper
Reviews.Content: Room may have been cleaned, but there was an old towel hanging in the bathroom and some other items around. Dark and noisy, drunks were fighting outside the room at midnight. Room smelled odd and was very worn out. Don't waste your money and time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: MOtravelbug
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Great staff that went out of their way to assist me. Clean and very comfortable rooms. Very comfortable beds. Rooms have been recently remodeled. Fridge, microwave, flat panel television, internet access, coffee maker, hairdryer. 24 hour pool. Hot tub. The hotel had a very nice breakfast area. This hotel is close to The Landing and Branson's historic district. I would definitely stay there again. My room was paid for by someone else. I'm not sure I would have chosen this hotel if I had been making my own reservation but now that I've stayed there, I would definitely stay again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all like pictured or described”
Reviews.Author: Guido65
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the downtown area of Branson which was very nice. We asked for a non-smoking room and got a smoking room, we then asked for another room and received another smoking room. The staff was very helpful in trying to take care of our problem, but still did not get the room we desired smoke-free. Both rooms were dirty and smelled very bad. The second room was dirty and looked as though soda had been splashed on the walls and the bathroom door. The doors to the rooms are very flimsy and did not seal so we had bugs coming in all night. The room was filled with dead bugs of all sorts on the carpet and tables that look as though they had not been cleaned in awhile. If we had any doubts about the neighborhood we would of not stay even the one night because the doors were so flimsy. The sheets on the bed were dirty looking and stained the comforter looked as though someone had urinated on it while sleeping. There are no markings in the area we stayed to say it was non-smoking, though the other building had non-smoking markings on all the doors. The front desk advised that it was a non-smoking room and they could not know what guest do in the room. The furniture and the carpet had cigarette burns and yet they had no clue to the fact a guest had smoked in that room. I would not stay here again even if my company or someone else paid and I could stay a week for free.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location away from the traffic of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTam
Reviews.Content: Due to the holiday crowds, a queen room was not available, so we reserved the King Suite. There was a separate room for the king sized bed, with a jacuzzi tub in the corner. The main room had the small fridge and microwave, and a sleeper sofa. When we first entered, I could smell that musty, motel room smell, so was a bit concerned. However, we turned on the ceiling fan, and it dissapated quickly. I surprised myself and made use of the jacuzzi a couple of times. The public hot tub was something I steered clear of. Really didn't look inviting. It was a free-standing tub, much like you would have on the deck in your backyard. Generally I stay at Hilton/Hyatt type properties, so am a bit spoiled. However, the bed was comfortable, even though not poshly made with upscale linens. There was a lot of noise coming from kids in the room directly above, reminding me of the days of apartment living. The breaksfast is continental. So its fix it yourself waffles, and there are ready to heat breakfast biscuits, yogurt, etc. It seemed to be well-stocked both early and late. The first morning we were awake early, so were one of the first to get there. The second morning we slept late, and got there during the last half hour of service. There was plenty available during both times. It is convenient to the Branson Landing Shopping area. You do need to be in generally good health to walk down the hill and back up, so not recommended for those with disabilities. But it is only a 3 block drive. We drove over to the strip on 76 to eat a meal, and were very thankful we were not staying in the mess of the traffic there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: lsutiger67
Reviews.Content: I contacted the property directly because we had some special needs. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The room was very clean, but a bit cramped for 3 people. The (indoor) pool was a nice size and clean. The apples at breakfast were particularly good!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western in Branson”
Reviews.Author: MissouriStudent
Reviews.Content: Best Western, Landing View is a great place to stay. Big indoor pool for the kids and a small, outdoor hot tub for adults. Rooms were clean and the rates were affordable. The continental breakfast was also good. I would recommend this hotel for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: napperton3116
Reviews.Content: This is nice hotel with a good breakfast but if you have a walking disability like I do you might want to go elsewhere. This property is located on a slanted hill and my husband had to drive me up the hill for breakfast since it is so steep. It is a very quiet place with nice shady trees even though it is near the road and the wireless internet signal was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: woodyadams
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was fine. The only problem we had was that we needed a crib and was under the impression that we would have one reserved. Apperenty they are first come first serve. But they were very helpful and offered us a king size room so we could put my 16 month old son in the bed between us. Pool was nice but we thought it was outdoor but they only have 1 indoor pool. Loved the location!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the ads”
Reviews.Author: joshswife
Reviews.Content: My family's experience was TERRIBLE. I asked specifically about the spa and if there were ironing boards in the room. The spa wasn't turned on, so if we wanted to use it, you had to wait 30 minutes for it to heat up. They acted like it was an inconvenience to them to have to turn it on. Once they did turn it on, it kept shutting off - so using the spa wasn't possible. Also, didn't realize it til it was too late, but the iron's were so filthy, you couldn't use them. The rooms smelled terrible, and no joke, found pubic hair in the shower and on the bathroom door. The receptionist was very unfriendly and not helpful at all. Also, continental breakfast was terrible - orange juice watered down, and not much to offer at all. Ads and pictures of motel are very deceiving - don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please stay away from this motel. I have to say this is the worsy motel I have ever stayed at. The beds were so horrible that my children couldn't even sleep, nor did my husband & me. The rooms seemed clean but the outside was filthy. The staff was not helpful. And between the noise (traffic seemed to go non stop and being on a hill next to the road it was horribaly loud) and the beds as I mentioned earlier no one got any sleep. Please do not give them your money. They shouldn't be open. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good/Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: ousoonergirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. The rooms were average size probably a little larger than some of the newer hotels. This is an older establishment. They are remodeling the rooms but the outside and corridors are trashy looking. The continential breakfast was lousy. Some of the others hotels in Branson have them beat hands down. They only serve donuts, apples, toast, or dry cereal. It's pretty blah!! The swimming pool is indoors and nice they only down side is it's only 3FT from end to end. We asked for a non-smoking room but the room smelled of smoke. I've come to the conclusion this is very common especially when you stay in an older hotel. I've experienced this several times in Branson. The front desk people are not that friendly. We had a difficult time finding a place to park one night because the parking lot was full. When we asked the fromt desk clerk were we could park. She acted like she didn't believe us when we told her the parking lot was full. We finally found a spot in a different parking lot very far away from our room. One good thing about the hotel was we did have a refrigerator, microwave, and coffeemaker.

Reviews.Title: “Friends to Branson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I felt I needed to write: This is THE WORST Motel/Hotel I have ever stayed at in my 44 years of traveling. Waited over an Hour for our rooms, Staff not friendly nor caring. I suggest (if you must) stay at this Motel STAY at YOUR OWN RISK! Don't expect much :/

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ldoll40
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and great but was on the side next to the street which was noisy as well as a church right across the street which was playing loud music at 8:00 am Sunday morning from an outside service (lousy quality speaker). The entire pool was only 3 foot deep both ends which was very disappointing to us as we were looking forward to a relaxing evening swim Sat. night. The continental breakfast consisted of doughnuts and coffee, that was pretty much it. The front desk staff were none too helpful in telling us where anything was when we checked in nor very friendly when we were checking out. We definitely won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly at check-in and check-out(5 minutes later). The room given to us, was not Best Western quality. It was dark, musty, and noisy. As I look at the pictures on their Web Site, I wonder if I was at the same Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. It was dirty, and the one bedroom suite was merely a large hotel room (not what I would consider a "suite.")

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Roeland Park, KS, a KC suburb
Reviews.Title: “Recently updated and great rates!!”
Reviews.Author: Joan A
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I did not read the previous review or we would have stayed elswhere! This is an older facility but it has recently been updated. It was VERY clean, had all the amnities we had at the more expensive hotels, and the pool was open 24 hours (!!!) . I was extremely pleased with the value for the price we paid! The staff was very friendly and helpful with the fastest routes to take to get to various attractions. The comp breakfast was pretty much the standard fare, but hey, at least they offered it! And the location is great! It is just a couple of blocks east of Highway 65, so you don't have to deal with the congestion of the main streets to get to your hotel, but it's easy to get to the back-roads to got to all the main attractions. Well worth the small price they ask!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Plus Landing View Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 403 W Main Street, Branson, MO 65616-2768
